Subject: Re: [OT] Passing parameters to methods (was RE: [junit] Re: Can I

On 01/09/05, Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:
 > I imagine that there could be a language that replaced parameter passing
 > by
 > an alternative mechanism, without being unpleasant. Of course to someone
 > used to parameter passing, it might look unpleasant at first, and he
 > probably would need to approach it with an open mind and experiment a lot
 > before being able to assess it fairly.

You could imagine that only constructors could take parameters--some 
kind of enshrinement of the Method Object refactoring pattern.  Then,

a.foo(b, c);

could be syntactic sugar for

new Foo(a, b, c).execute();

Actually, this would be an enshrinement of the Command pattern, I think: 
every method invocation is really the execution of a reifiable command.

<Desparately trying to drag myself back on-topic>
In that case, JUnit could be seen as a precursor of a new concept in 
object-oriented runtimes.
</Desparate>

    David Saff
